text: Hey guys, I posted on the <#C017Z6Q3WS3|pluto> channel, but got no answers. Does anyone know of any initiative to create a vim-mode for Pluto? It's the only thing that's keeping me from using it. I really like the vim-mode on Jupyter, I was wondering how hard it would be to port it to Pluto. Has anyone taken a look at it?

elements.text: Hey guys, I posted on the

channel, but got no answers. Does anyone know of any initiative to create a vim-mode for Pluto? It's the only thing that's keeping me from using it. I really like the vim-mode on Jupyter, I was wondering how hard it would be to port it to Pluto. Has anyone taken a look at it?

text: you are mostly will have luck using Neptune and asking for this feature than asking pluto developers.

elements.text: you are mostly will have luck using Neptune and asking for this feature than asking pluto developers.

text: pluto guys are quiet not open to feature requests which is the reason someone forked it and created Neptune

elements.text: pluto guys are quiet not open to feature requests which is the reason someone forked it and created Neptune

text: Thanks. I'll take a look at Neptune. Last time I checked, the package had very few contributors, so I got turned off.

elements.text: Thanks. I'll take a look at Neptune. Last time I checked, the package had very few contributors, so I got turned off.

text: Distinction: they're open to feature requests that align with their design vision, which is very explicit and upfront about their target audience and trade offs.
